post_text: Here are some suggestions for parents who drive their students to a bus stop that can help increase student safety: Park along side the road in the same direction of travel. Use park lights instead of leaving headlights on when it is dark. Headlights can blind other drivers. Stay parked until all students are done loading or unloading and the bus has turned off the red lights. Buses will wait for commuters who want to leave before the bus or they will pull over at the next safe turnout so commuters can pass. Have students gather backpacks and coats as soon as they see the bus coming so they can be ready and waiting outside of the car when the bus stops. Have them wait at least 15 feet from the bus and approach the bus only after it has come to a complete stop. Thank you for you patience and help as we strive to transport students safely.

The curb side (right) lane of the drop off loop is where vehicles can stop to unload while leaving the outside (left) lane open for vehicles who have already unloaded to proceed to exit the loop. Thank you for helping us keep our students safe and assisting in making parent drop-off more efficient.
